$description: Core sizing primitives for component dimensions. These raw size values define the available heights and widths in the system. Use these primitives in component tokens to ensure visual consistency. Based on a combination of 4px grid and Mantine's size scale.

sizing.$description: Primitive size scale for heights and widths. Values are named by their pixel equivalent for clarity. Use these in component tokens (button.height, input.height, icon.size) rather than directly in components.

12.$description: 12px size. Use for: small icons, compact indicators, inline elements.

16.$description: 16px size. Use for: standard icons, small UI elements.

20.$description: 20px size. Use for: medium icons, default icon size.

24.$description: 24px size. Use for: large icons, action icons.

30.$description: 30px size. Use for: extra small component heights (xs buttons/inputs).

32.$description: 32px size. Use for: extra large icons, feature icons.

36.$description: 36px size. Use for: small component heights (sm buttons/inputs).

42.$description: 42px size. Use for: medium component heights (md buttons/inputs). DEFAULT for most interactive elements.

48.$description: 48px size. Use for: large component heights (lg buttons/inputs), touch-optimized targets.

60.$description: 60px size. Use for: extra large component heights (xl buttons/inputs), marketing elements.
